medical_history.chief_complaint: Persistent scleritis not responding to prescribed therapy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient 1, a 40-year-old male mechanic, experienced severe ocular pain, headache, redness, discharge, and photophobia after a work-related injury. Symptoms began at the time of injury and persisted without improvement over 18 months, despite multiple treatments. Patient 2, a 34-year-old female medical assistant, had reduced vision and acute pain in the left eye that progressed to persistent pain and visual acuity issues over six months without improvement.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patient 1 has a history of mild diabetes mellitus. Patient 2's personal medical history is unremarkable, but she has a family history of a hereditary neurologic disease, as two of her siblings died of it.
medical_history.family_history: Patient 2's two siblings had recently died of a hereditary neurologic disease. Patient 1's family history is not specified.
medical_history.social_history: Patient 1 was not working and was receiving disability compensation during the 18-month course of the disease. Patient 2's social history is not specified.
